citation.article-title: Pusillimonas ginsengisoli sp. nov., isolated from soil of a ginseng field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pusillimonas ginsengisoli. sp. nov.
Pusillimonas ginsengisoli (gin.sen.gi.so′li. N.L. n. ginsengum ginseng; L. n. solum -i soil; N.L. gen. n. ginsengisoli of soil of a ginseng field, the source of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, motile, short rods, 0.5–0.8 μm long and 0.3–0.6 μm in diameter.
Colonies are pale yellow and circular with an entire margin after growth on nutrient agar at 30 °C for 5 days.
Grows at 15–40 °C (optimum 30 °C), but not at 4 or 42 °C, and at pH 5.5–9.0 (optimum pH 7.0).

Produces acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase (C8), leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, trypsin and valine arylamidase.

Does not produce N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, arginine dihydrolase, α-fucosidase, β-galactosidase (PNPG hydrolysis), α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase (starch hydrolysis), β-glucosidase (aesculin hydrolysis), β-glucuronidase, lipase (C14), α-mannosidase, protease (gelatin hydrolysis) or urease.
Assimilates acetate, adipate, l-alanine, citrate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, itaconate, dl-lactate, l-malate, phenylacetate, l-proline, propionate, l-serine and n-valerate.

Does not assimilate N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, caprate, l-fucose, gluconate, d-glucose, glycogen, l-histidine, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, myo-inositol, l-rhamnose, salicin, d-sorbitol, suberate or sucrose.

The major fatty acids (>5 %) are 19 : 0 cyclo ω8c, 16 : 0, summed feature 2 (iso-16 : 1 I and/or 14 : 0 3-OH), 17 : 0 cyclo, summed feature 3 (16 : 1ω6c and/or 16 : 1ω7c), summed feature 8 (18 : 1ω7c and/or 18 : 1ω6c), 14 : 0 and 18 : 0.

The predominant polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol; moderate amounts of unknown aminolipids and diphosphatidylglycerol and minor amounts of unknown aminophospholipids and lipids are also found.
The G+C content of the type strain is 57.3 mol % (HPLC).
The type strain, DCY25T (=KCTC 22046T =JCM 14767T), and strain DCY28 (=KCTC 22047 =JCM 14768) were isolated from soil of a ginseng field near Daejeon city, in South Korea.
